content:
This PR redefines Fin.castPred so that it is no longer dependent on Fin.predAbove for its definition, and makes it work like Fin.pred - i.e. it is no longer defined on last (n + 1) instead of simply repeating a value there.

This makes it more consistent with Fin.pred, as stated, and means that it now relates to Fin.castSucc exactly as Fin.pred does to Fin.succ.

Potentially, I could see std wanting to import it down the line, as it is now much less dependent on larger Mathlib definitions. But that's a separate matter.

This relates to #9145, but reading that PR or its discussion thread is not necessary for discussing this PR. It splits off one of that PR's components to reduce the size of its diff.
Looks good to me. Are there particular points you want to discuss?
No, I think this one speaks for itself. I'm just pushing a patch that corrects some lemma names and adds a couple I missed.
The main criteria for closing this should be that castPred and pred now have identically symmetrical lemmas. If you're happy with that, that's all I can hope for.
ok :peace_sign:

The only thing I could do is that the version of predAbove_below in this patch is arguably a bit worse - in the sense that it doesn't reduce to castPred - but I think it's better to make that change when I change the definition, and that should be a future patch (probably the next one in this series, on reflection).
The change in definition unlike this one won't change its signature or values, it will just make it a clearer pair to succAbove.
Thanks for the speedy review. I will merge this once it passes CI.
Wrenna Robson has marked this topic as resolved.
